Question: Which of the following statements about special senses is correct?
Answer: All special senses, except smell, rely on specialized receptor cells to detect stimuli.
Distractor1: Special sense input is carried by both spinal and cranial neurons.
Distractor2: Special sense stimuli are detected by the receptive endings of sensory neurons.
Distractor3: Special senses detect stimuli such as touch, pain, and temperature.

Question: In olfaction, activation of G-protein-coupled receptors leads to the formation of __________.
Specialized epithelial cells that contain receptors to detect taste are called __________.
Which of the following disorders might result in an inability to sense taste from the anterior two-thirds of the tongue?
Which of the extrinsic eye muscles passes through the trochlea?
The area of the retina that contains a high density of photoreceptors and enables us to focus on a particular object is called __________.
While viewing a colorful painting in a museum, you will mostly use your __________.
Which of the following statements correctly describes transduction in photoreceptors when light stimulates them?
Answer: Photoreceptor cells hyperpolarize and stop inhibiting bipolar cells.
Distractor1: Photoreceptors depolarize and stimulate bipolar cells.
Distractor2: Photoreceptors depolarize and inhibit bipolar cells.
Distractor3: Photoreceptors hyperpolarize and inhibit bipolar cells.

Question: Which of the following is NOT one of the auditory ossicles?
Which of the following structures of the inner ear is/are filled with perilymph?
Vibrations of the auditory ossicles are transmitted to the cochlea via the __________.
The loud sound of a police siren will cause __________.
Answer: strong vibrations of the endolymph and basilar membrane at the base of the cochlea
Distractor1: weak vibrations of the endolymph and basilar membrane at the base of the cochlea
Distractor2: strong vibrations of the endolymph and basilar membrane farther up the cochlea
Distractor3: weak vibrations of the endolymph and basilar membrane farther up the cochlea

Question: When stereocilia of the hair cells of the maculae bend towards the kinocilium, __________.
Answer: stimulation of the vestibular nerve increases
Distractor1: stimulation of the vestibular nerve decreases
Distractor2: stimulation of the olfactory nerve increases
Distractor3: stimulation of the olfactory nerve decreases

Question: Which of the following special senses is NOT processed by the thalamus?
